Logger-format.syntax:
template<typename Argument>
static sequence<char8> Logger::format(Argument&& argument)
Logger-format.description: For the `Argument` template parameter, the overload `Logger& operator<<(Logger&, const Argument&)` **must** be defined.

Logger-format.syntax:
template<typename Argument, typename... PackedArgument>
static sequence<char8> Logger::format(view<char8> pattern, Argument&& argument, PackedArgument&&... packedArguments)
Logger-format.description:
Uses the [argument injection patterns](#Argument injection pattern) found in `pattern` to inject each formatted argument at the right position. If there are more arguments than injection patterns, the remaining arguments are silently discarded.

For the `Argument` template parameter, the overload `Logger& operator<<(Logger&, const Argument&)` **must** be defined.
Additionally, for each unique `PackedArgument` template parameter different than `Argument`, the overload `Logger& operator<<(Logger&, const PackedArgument&)` **must** be defined.

ConsoleLogger-ConsoleLogger.syntax: explicit ConsoleLogger::ConsoleLogger(std::ostream& stream, LogLevel minLogLevel, view<char8> source)

ConsoleLogger-operator<<.description: Ends the current [SGR control sequence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code#Select_Graphic_Rendition_parameters), if there is one.
